title: Impulse - force from impulse and time

content.question: A constant force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> delivers an impulse <math alttext="J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi></math> to an object over time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. A second constant force delivers an impulse <math alttext="2 J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>J</mi></math> to the same object over a time <math alttext="the fraction t over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. What is the magnitude of the second force?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
